function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Variation in testing procedures and analysis methods for detecting coronavirus genetic material in environmental samples","Impact":"Inaccurate or inconsistent results in determining the presence and infectivity of coronavirus genetic material","Mitigation":"Standardization of testing procedures and analysis methods, validation of results through infectivity tests","Technologies":"Advanced RT-qPCR analysis, infectivity assays, and phylogenetic analyses","People":"Research and laboratory staff, public health authorities, government agencies","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, government regulatory bodies"},{"Description":"Lack of understanding about the correlation between wastewater-based analysis and acute infection cases","Impact":"Inability to accurately link wastewater data to infection cases in a given region","Mitigation":"Development of methodologies to establish correlations, integration of wastewater surveillance with clinical data","Technologies":"Statistical modeling, data integration and analysis, epidemiological studies","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, wastewater treatment professionals","Owner":"Health research institutions, government health departments"},{"Description":"Uncertainty about the distribution and survival of SARS-CoV-2 in the aquatic environment","Impact":"Potential risk of exposure to infectious SARS-CoV-2 in water bodies","Mitigation":"Studies on virus distribution and survival in aquatic environments, development of water treatment methods to inactivate the virus","Technologies":"Environmental sampling techniques, virus inactivation technologies, water quality monitoring","People":"Environmental researchers, water quality experts, public health authorities","Owner":"Research institutions, environmental protection agencies"}]}
